definitions.text: a socially awkward or tactless act
a minor inadvertent mistake usually observed in speech or writing or in small accidents or memory lapses etc.
potter's clay that is thinned and used for coating or decorating ceramics
a part (sometimes a root or leaf or bud) removed from a plant to propagate a new plant through rooting or grafting
a young and slender person
examples: he's a mere slip of a lad

definitions.text: a place where a craft can be made fast
an accidental misstep threatening (or causing) a fall
examples: he blamed his slip on the ice
the jolt caused many slips and a few spills

definitions.text: a slippery smoothness
examples: he could feel the slickness of the tiller

definitions.text: artifact consisting of a narrow flat piece of material
a small sheet of paper
a woman's sleeveless undergarment
bed linen consisting of a cover for a pillow
examples: the burglar carried his loot in a pillowcase

definitions.text: an unexpected slide
a flight maneuver; aircraft slides sideways in the air
the act of avoiding capture (especially by cunning)
move stealthily
examples: The ship slipped away in the darkness

definitions.text: insert inconspicuously or quickly or quietly
examples: He slipped some money into the waiter's hand

definitions.text: move obliquely or sideways, usually in an uncontrolled manner
examples: the wheels skidded against the sidewalk

definitions.text: get worse
move smoothly and easily
examples: water slipped from the polished marble

definitions.text: to make a mistake or be incorrect
pass on stealthily
examples: He slipped me the key when nobody was looking

definitions.text: move easily
cause to move with a smooth or sliding motion
examples: he slipped the bolt into place

definitions.text: pass out of one's memory
move out of position
examples: the artificial hip joint luxated and had to be put back surgically
